thread.title: Warren Jones appointed TIACA directorTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Warren Jones appointed TIACA directorTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Warren Jones appointed TIACA director
Warren Jones has been appointed TIACA Director, reporting into Doug Brittin, Secretary General and based at the Association’s Miami headquarters, USA.
Kenneth Gibson has been made Manager – Accounts and Business Development, also based in Miami.
Jones, whose most recent role was President of Cargo Network Services (CNS) at IATA, will focus primarily on TIACA’s sales initiatives and will also manage other aspects of the Association’s commercial development programs and operations.
“Warren’s extensive experience and industry knowledge and Kenneth’s background with airfreight will be tremendous assets as we focus on our three pillars of advocacy, networking, and knowledge, and we are delighted they are joining the team,” said Brittin.
“With so many new regulations and developments on the horizon in our industry, TIACA’s position as the only Association representing and bringing together all sectors in the industry has never been more important.”
Gibson will be supporting Jones and developing TIACA’s sales strategy. He will be an important point of contact for TIACA members.
“I am very pleased to be joining the TIACA team at such an exciting time for the Association,” said Jones.
“We are busy growing our membership and planning for the ACF in Paris next year, which promises to be a well-attended event with plenty of content and networking opportunities.”
Jones brings over 18 years’ air cargo experience to his new post, including senior roles at the International Air Transport Association (IATA), Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, and Chapman Freeborn. Jones’ most recent role was President of Cargo Network Services (CNS) at IATA.
In 2012, he led a team, including Delta Airlines, Metro Atlanta Chamber, and UPS, to bring TIACA’s Air Cargo Forum (ACF) to Atlanta for its 50th anniversary conference, the most successful in the history of the event.
As Aviation Development Manager at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, Jones helped eight all-cargo and three passenger airlines initiate service into Atlanta and in 2011 and 2012, he was the President of the Atlanta Air Cargo Association and the Chairman of the ACI-NA Air Cargo Subcommittee.
Prior to joining the airport, Jones worked with Chapman Freeborn and Martinair Cargo.
In 2010, he was presented the Metro Atlanta Chamber’s Supply Chain Professional of the Year award.
Gibson brings a decade of experience in the logistics and finance sectors, having previously worked for organizations including IATA, Kerry Logistics, and World Fuel Services.
“I am delighted to be working with Warren and the team in Miami,” said Gibson.
“I am looking forward to growing TIACA’s membership and developing new ideas for the Association.”
